info.title: Drum & Monkey, Alderley Edge
info.address: Moss Rose, Alderley Edge SK9 7LD, United Kingdom

data.text: Really enjoyed a meal here last night, good food and surroundings. A real hidden gem in Alderley Edge!
data.name: Mark Liddell

data.text: Visited the pub for the second time. The first we had a rude member of staff the second time was even worse and we walked out. They say they have a friendly atmosphere on the board as you walk in but clearly there are some members of staff that don't live up to this. There are others that do but on two occasions we have had bad eggs. We won't be giving this place our money ever again and can't recommend it. My first bad review I've ever left on Google reviews
data.name: Raj

data.text: Really good Sunday lunch, if any criticism could have been hotter,  but we were a party of 12
data.name: Philip Penny

data.text: Visited for a lunchtime meet up. Excellent food and wine at a fair price. Friendly and efficient service.
data.name: Ian Carr
Martin Wadsworth
data.responseFromOwnerText: I would interested in why you have only given us a 2 star rating but not actually left a review!!!!!!

data.text: Amazing night for a huge group booking. We were a table of 29 and brilliantly looked after by Ann and the team. Food was wonderful and so was the service.
data.name: Fairuz

data.text: Only deliver fish 🐟 but looks nice
data.name: Kevin Mozley

data.text:
Personally for me if you are only going to offer a roast on a Sunday it has to be memorable. Mine was but unfortunately for the wrong reasons.

Firstly bar the potatoes mine came with no vegetables not a problem my family shared, I wish they hadn’t if I had wanted to take up darts I could of used the carrots this was followed by soggy, cold roast potatoes and Yorkshire puddings that were like cardboard.
data.name: Emma Wild

data.text:
Hold tight it's a beauty

Soooooo..... We're to start. I met Nick in Altrincham one evening in my local. Nice normal chap who stated he was a city fan. Bull5hit!

Anyway after a few scoops bought by me he says he was the head chef at the drum and monkey at Alderley edge. Come in and ask for me you can have a Sunday lunch and you and Mrs just pay for drinks! Sound

7 weeks later text and ring to drop in yeah no probs!! Sweet see you in 40mins.

Hi its Adam got told to ask for nick ohhhh yeah please come in let's seat you and order drinks and we will send Nick out. Bull5hit never ever came out.

Ordered mains and tbf the cheese ND onion pie and chips was decent but my Mrs chicken in mushroom sauce was dryer than Nick The Greeks flip flop.

How was the food!?! Bcos we thought it was free we said zip. Yeah was lovely. Bill Please!

No discount no nick and two p!ssed off customers that won't eat there again.

Average at above average prices.

Show less
Date of visit: October 2023
data.name: Adam Metcalfe
data.responseFromOwnerText: Hi I'm  very sad about your review. However, it is obvious that you have a personal issue with Nick & not the pub  and think it is highly unfair that you take it out on my business.  Ann

data.name: S D
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review.  Ann

data.text: Highly recommend this place, great food & lovely staff xx
data.name: Caroline Craston
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your kind review.  I am very pleased you enjoyed your visit with us.

data.text: We had a wonderful Sunday roast outside enjoying the last of the summer sun. Our dog was reseated like royalty! We will be back!
data.name: Simi Agunbiade
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your kind review.  I am pleased you enjoyed your Sunday roast.

data.text: Great Sunday roast, lovely staff and fab atmosphere. Thank you team Drum & Monkey
data.name: Jo Boswell
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your kind review.  I'm pleased you enjoyed your roast. Ann

data.text:
Lovely pub...attentive service
Only had a sandwich...was nice but bread was a bit doughy...
Pudding  was fab....just could have been hotter.....
Overall  would be happy to come again
data.name: Pauline Hannon
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your review.  I'm sorry you found the bread a bit doughy & the pudding wasn't as hot as you would of liked. I will look into that . I'm am pleased you would come again. Thank you.

data.text: Six months ago the "drum" seemed to have lost its way but with the new team in charge it is back with a bang. Great food, friendly staff and a very pleasant atmosphere. I have a local again.
data.name: peter macfarlane
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your very kind review.  I am so pleased you will be using us as your local pub again.

data.name: Mirrors and Glass
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review, it is very much appreciated.  Ann

data.text: I don’t normally post many reviews. However…  recently taken over and Callum The chef is back along with the kitchen staff. Excellent Sunday roast- we had sharing platter well worth trying. 😊 wish the new owner the best of luck.
data.name: Carole Booth
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your kind review Carole.  I am pleased you enjoyed your meal. Ann

data.name: Paul mcneela
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your review.  It is greatly appreciated.  Ann

data.text: Super friendly and relaxed welcoming,  good food.
data.name: Stephen Green
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your feedback. It is very much appreciated. Ann

data.name: Alexandra Furness
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your feedback. It is greatly appreciated.  Ann

data.text: New owner is lovely & not afraid to get stuck in! Defo a new local hot spot for the family!
data.name: Kay
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your kind feedback. It is much appreciated. Ann

data.text: Went for afternoon drink with friends. Very enjoyable. Worth a visit.
data.name: David Potts
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you very much for your review. It is much appreciated. Ann

data.name: PAUL MCNEELA
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review. It is greatly appreciated.  Ann

data.name: Lawrence McNeela
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review.  It is greatly appreciated.  Ann

data.text: Always good.
data.name: Angelo Trapasso
data.responseFromOwnerText: We are so glad you enjoyed your time here with us!

data.name: Christian Boyd
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review Christian. It is much appreciated.  Ann

data.text: Great food. Lovely beer garden
data.name: A S
data.responseFromOwnerText: Thank you for your review . It is much appreciated.  Ann

data.text: Fantastic
data.name: Macclesfield maggpie

data.text: Amazing Sunday roast
data.name: cheryl Hanrahan

data.text: Tasty Sunday lunch, large garden and friendly staff.
data.name: Kevin G Hawkins

data.text: Very pleasant pub in Altrincham - friendly staff, good beer and a wide range of different seating options. Didn’t have time to eat but a good, traditional menu and will try next time
data.name: John Anderson

data.text: Friendly bar staff, good parking abd drinks choice but no food after 9pm
data.name: Linda Lee

data.text: Great beer garden
data.name: Stephen Pearce

data.text: Great food and service, very friendly, not too busy
data.name: Mike Corlett

data.text: I had one of the "sandwiches" by way of a lighter lunch. It came with chips and was excellent.
data.name: Pete Scotson

data.text: Nice Sunday dinner, fresh vegetables and tasty chicken. Cheese pie was nice but a little bit dry. Desserts lovely.  Eton mess cheesecake and chocolate fudge cake.
data.name: Denise Sambrook

data.text:
Called into the drum Wednesday after a walk over the edge it was our first visit to the pub it definitely will not be our last when we saw it was a Robinson's house we were well pleased
The pub was clean with good tables & chairs the landlord was very welcoming we had three pints of dizzy blonde bitter & very nice it was too a good find 👍
data.name: Alan Schofield

data.text: Lovely place and really nice staff
data.name: Paul Bateman

data.text: Amazing pub both family and dog friendly , staff was so kind and pleasant amazing customer service. Food was delicious we had the lamb rump and braised steak and shared a sticky pudding For desert. Sam, Lewis and the team have really settled in:)
data.name: Issac Goodwin

data.text: Fab food and service, very cosy!
data.name: Julie Benn

data.text: Significant improvement since new ownership took over. Highly recommend a visit.
data.name: Nick JM

data.text: Excellent fresh food and service from Sam and his team. Will definitely return.
data.name: Deborah Collin

data.text: Food was excellent and staff great, new manager Sam and his team are really getting to grips with the Drum ❤️
data.name: Paul Johnson

data.text:
First visit what a hidden gem.
Great food no room for dessert
Friendly attentive staff.
data.name: ashleigh mckenna

data.text: A good welcome and good Sunday lunch
data.name: David Bostock

data.text: I like this place. Decent beer, large beer garden, good pub food. Room available for functions/ groups. Dog friendly. Have held several running club and family events here, always well looked after. One of only 2 pubs in Alderley Edge village(this and the de Trafford Arms), the Drum is all the better for being off the main Street
data.name: David Morris

data.text: Lovely local pub. Great beers and a nice place to sit with friends.
data.name: Daniel Winston

data.text: Tucked away. Pleasant lunch. Pleasant staff
data.name: Darren Halket

data.text:
Loved the food. We had Sunday roast and the meat was so moist, and Yorkshire puddings huge. Really loved the food.

Service was quite slow though, had to ask for plates to be cleared and grab waitresses attention for drinks.

Would go back
data.name: Leigh Kruger-Ives

data.text: Beautiful place and very Christmassy but the food I ordered was far too salty.
data.name: Lorelei Darlaston

data.text: Food was great and we were looked after by the brilliant Sam Taylor who even got the fire going for us. Service was excellent
data.name: Joyce Hall

data.text: Very enjoyable Sunday lunch
data.name: Richard Ignatowicz

data.text: Mediocre
data.name: Andrew Newman

data.text: Had a great Sunday roast. Calamari starter was ace too. Nice place and great staff.
data.name: Michael Bischof

data.text: Really nice lunch as usual. Great Service. The place was a little bit chilly as the fire wasn't lit but not a complaint.
data.name: kay glynn

data.text: Gorgeous place staff were amazing and the food was great.
data.name: Neil Nightingall

data.text: Lovely pub. Very dog friendly. Great outdoor area with heating. Staff really pleasent. Only slight draw back is menue is a little limited for choice. Will definitely be returning.
data.name: Simon

data.text:
Great food and good beer.

Dodgy company - but I’d taken my own so it wasn’t really their fault.
data.name: Piers

data.text: Had such a tasty lunch in this gorgeous place, staff were so friendly & helpful.. can’t wait for our next visit! Perfect for families with kids too.
data.name: Leesa Robinson

data.text: Best Sunday roast in Cheshire
data.name: Adam Harrison

data.text: Excellent
data.name: Maria Gligan

data.text: Enjoy this place and thanks for recommendation of Rose Lemon ade its perfect! 🌹
data.name: Cheryl Carey

data.text: Only popped in for a quick drink looked nice
data.name: Mr D

data.text:
Staff were extremely nice and they are dog friendly, even for big dogs !

Good food and selection of drinks. Reasonably priced for a slightly more upmarket place
data.name: Dom Aye

data.text: The outdoor area was great - really big and if you have kids take a ball maybe as lots of grass which is enclosed- people were lovely :)
data.name: William Davies

data.text: nice food. Good service. Plenty of car park and plenty of outside table for summer sunshine!
data.name: Su Su San

data.text:
Nice friendly pub.

Not recommended if you are into craft / real ale though.
data.name: Timo Wilson

data.text: Massive! Whole large chicken for 2. Massive Yorkshire's, great gravy. Nicely cooked veg. Loads of roast potatoes. Large portion of ice cream. Will be visiting again.
data.name: Adrian Goldstone

data.text: Great little secret pub, off the main drag in alderley edge. Great food and beer selection, and large outdoor garden with a massive covered area for those not so sunny days!
data.name: Paul Morris

data.text: Good food and great staff.
data.name: Andy R

data.text: Superb pub and beer is fantastic.
data.name: Steve Butterworth

data.text: Great food helpful staff .Would highly recommend.
data.name: Jayne Worthington

data.text: Cracking food here, well worth a visit
data.name: Richard Stowe

data.text: I really like this pub, it somehow feels old fashioned whilst providing modern standards of service, which is an appealing mix. The food is decent value and a nice beer in front of the log burner is very welcome. You also need to chat with the Assistant Manager, what a real character. Also has a nice beer garden and lawns, great for kids
data.name: Craig Russell

data.text: Very nice pub 👍
data.name: steve smith

data.text:
Fantastic little pub situated behind the huddle and bustle of Alderley Edge. Patio area, picnic benches on the grass area so kids can have freedom but still in sight.

We only had starters here but they were well presented, priced well and delicious. The reason for 4 stars is staff attentiveness. Glasses not being removed from table and food menus not given when requested.
data.name: charlie aston

data.text: A disappointing experience this time around.  Staff are as friendly as ever,  and the service to order the drinks and food was fine but there was nearly an hour wait for the food itself to arrive. Staff shortages or some such excuse. Food quality was patchy: sea bass, burger and fish and chips were great; Ceasar salad was all lettuce and chicken was cooked to toughness. Bit of a shame.
data.name: Richard Harrison

data.text: Excellent Sunday roast
data.name: Eileen French

data.text: Excellent beer garden
data.name: Jordan Burgin

data.text: Very nice meal.
data.name: Stephen Cannon

data.text: Went for Sunday lunch on Mother's Day. Staff very friendly and food was delicious. Would highly recommend and will be back next time we are in the Manchester area. Well done to the staff who always had a smile and time to speak even though they were extremely busy.
data.name: Ann Botting

data.text:
Still a nice to eat will be back
A return visit after 3 years did not dissapoint had fish and chips excellent
Highly reccomend.
data.name: J

data.text: Very nice pub. Bear garden outside is fantastic, open space, safe for kids.
data.name: Michal D.

data.text: Many years since we were last here. It has been tastefully decorated and redesigned. Lovely and varied outside eating areas, good food. So lovely to return and fine it so well looked after and very smart.
data.name: Pauline TRANTER

data.text: I really enjoyed the food, everything was perfectly cooked and taste great. The service was great although they were busy. I will definitely visit again.
data.name: Terri cloake

data.text: Another good local pub which is well frequented by locals and does a solid job of serving decent, if not amazing, beer. Nice large venue with big outdoor area
data.name: Paul Dean

data.text: Nice play area beer garden
data.name: Nina Hindley

data.text: Had a lovely lunch, the staff was very helpful
data.name: Maureen Nicholls

data.text: Great tasty food and fab service
data.name: Andy Townsend

data.text: Brilliant place
data.name: ste shaw

data.text: Lovely place warm & welcoming. Delicious food and the staff were very attentive and lovely. Thoroughly enjoyed it.
data.name: Elle J

data.text: Always enjoyed the quality of the fish and chips but not today. Opted for the small portions and they were smaller than normal. The chips skinner than previously and the fish had an after taste. Well below par. Put us off going again. We go about 6/7 times a year
data.name: Tony Jackson

data.text: It was our first visit to this lovely pub. We had our dog with us and he was along with us given a warm welcome from the staff. Excellent food and service. The syrup sponge and custard was delicious!! Looking forward to our next visit to this delightful pub.
data.name: Claire Davenport

data.text: When we visited on Sunday it was really busy and crowded. It doesn’t feel relaxed. We both had the roast and it is very lacking. The Yorkshire puddings look great but they are dry and flaky, the veg/sides with the roast are limited and poor. If you want a good Sunday roast, I wouldn’t recommend going here
data.name: Ciara Norman

data.text: Splendid
data.name: craig wilcoxon

data.text: I'm here now eating the worst and most expensive fish and chips I've ever had.
data.name: Brody

data.text: Great local pub
data.name: Ian Williams

data.text: Amazing food
data.name: Emma Kelly

data.text: Called in for Sunday lunch lamb to share fantastic
data.name: Grant Hird

data.text: Great pub friendly staff good service
data.name: terence mclean

data.text: Fab and friendly family pub. We stopped here for a coffee after a walk.
data.name: Lynn Mills (scouse_mouse)

data.text: Very pleasant evening.
data.name: Paul Clarke

data.text: Nice atmosphere, food was good. Nothing special though
data.name: Anthony Cunningham

data.text: Food was ok, great service and nice pub
data.name: Michael Lampard

data.text: Ive only visited the pub at lunchtime, its a large pub with lots of outdoor seating covered and uncovered, food served lunch and evening.
data.name: ROBERT QUINN

data.text: Great service. Friendly staff. Lovely Sunday roast.
data.name: Louise McCarthy-Teague

data.text: This pub is, Epic!  Great family friendly place.  We just had the BEST roast beef Sunday dinner, plates left clean.   Staff very welcoming and happy to chat.  So glad we came,  would recommend to others.
data.name: Lucy Heaps

data.text: Just ok
data.name: Julie McDermott

data.text: Food took 50m to arrive. Pie dish not big portion and was still hungry afterwards. Pie similar to what you would buy at the artisan market. Would not recommend
data.name: Stuart Carr

data.text: Great place, friendly staff, good food and beer, plus plenty of room for kids and dogs. Loved it, thank you 👍
data.name: Simon Blade

data.text: Lovely pub , staff where fantastic , as was the food. Couldn't believe the size of my starter, didn't leave much room for my main. Would definitely recommend
data.name: kris edwards

data.text: First time going and I was far from disappointed. Amazing food and amazing service. The atmosphere is welcoming and relaxing. Yet fun with the interaction of the staff. Highly recommended and I will certainly be going back again very soon
data.name: Dave C Roberts

data.text: A nice friendly pub, and the seating area out side looks great 👍
data.name: Tony Witter

data.text: Went for a private birthday in the small marquee in the garden. Food was excellent, company was great and staff were attentive.
data.name: Andrew Schofield

data.text: Absolutely brilliant Sunday roast best in a long time
data.name: Adam Roberts

data.text: Lovly chilled place , friendly and warm nice food
data.name: Matthew Elmes

data.text: Have been a number of times before..usually excellent,  but despite being quiet with lots of staff around the service had to be prompted, on several occasions, the wine we ordered was not available,  my steak and ale pie was dry and almost inedible, we complained and 25 % of the cost if my pie was deducted -whoop whoop!! ...my wife was also not overly impressed with her curry either....perhaps an off day????
data.name: Kevin Pearson

data.text: Lovely country pub feel yet situated in the gorgeous village of Alderley Edge. Relaxing and tranquil garden with both covered and open air seating. Good quality 'pub grub' / gourmet pub menu.
data.name: Tom Peach

data.text: Nice beer garden nice food
data.name: kevan hibbert

data.text:
Top pint of Guinness.
Lots of outdoor space.
Good attentive waiting staff.
Highly recommended.
data.name: simon mendelson

data.text: Lovely  pub  nice staff.  We went to the  artisan Market  it was really lovely.
data.name: Alan donohue

data.text: Good food but need to update gluten free options
data.name: Katherine Claydon-Park

data.text: Good food! Lovely garden, good choice of drinks
data.name: Jayne Thompson

data.text: £10.50p for a plate of chips enough said!
data.name: Christopher Farrer

data.text: Stopped off here for a Sunday lunch as part of a cycling day. An oasis in a rain storm. Never have we been so pleased to see patio heaters to help us dry out. The food was good and well priced. The staff were all very friendly and attentive and so deserved their tip.
data.name: Ian Collin

data.text:
This pub is tucked down a quiet lane, mostly hidden from the main road and it is an absolute gem to visit.
Lovely food. Staff were so attentive and everything was brought out quickly.
The Peri-peri half chicken on the special menu was had by both of us as our main course and wow was it good!
Only suggestion would be for the pub to get some soya milk/almond/oat so those of us who fancy a coffee who can't handle lactose can still enjoy one after the lovely meal.
Can't wait to return, thanks to the team at the Drum and Monkey.
data.name: S Leonard

data.text: Lovely evening at The Drum & Monkey last week. The food was delicious and we were very well looked after by Akay and Daisy. We very much appreciated Akay's advice on the wine, and what a young hard worker Daisy is - a lovely asset to the team. Great to get out to eat again and very glad we chose The Drum & Monkey!
data.name: Jane Austin

data.text: Really lovely table in the garden and a superb Sunday Lunch 😀
data.name: Samantha Holden

data.text: Nice environment but the food was terrible. Avoid the burgers
data.name: Ross Northcote

data.text:
Slow service, waited over 10 minutes to be asked what we'd like to drink then waited over 20 minutes for our 4 drinks. Left after one to the Horse n Jockey in Wilmslow!

May try again on a less busy day as always here good reviews from here.
data.name: Molly May

data.text: Very poor experience, never felt welcomed "just find a table"... Sat and waited to get attention had to wave/heckle staff for service. Food just OK. Won't return....
data.name: Steve Greenup

data.text: What a night claire was the best looked after us all best barmaid ever
data.name: phil carney

data.text: Always a great venue with the staff and food excellent on every visit
data.name: David Hadfield

data.text: Really lovely
data.name: MICHAEL LYONS

data.text: Staff very pleasant and quite understand wevevall been going through very difficult times.  Unfortunately   my vegetarian pie crust was so hard I couldn't eat it.  Seemed like it had been baked a number of times. Must admit I didn't bring it to the staff's attention until the meal was ended.   Was so excited to see the ladies I used to work with & didn't want to spoil the mood, although everyone remarked how much I was struggling to eat this tough pastry.  A gesture of something would have much appreciated.
data.name: Jean Nield

data.text:
Had an enjoyable meal here yesterday. Food was good and service excellent.
The only problem is allowing dogs into the dining room. Fine in the bar, but a no no in the dining room
data.name: Elizabeth Brown

data.text: Good food and large portions in a friendly environment.
data.name: Mike Lamb

data.text: Well organised COVID safety measures. Food could improve but still nice.
data.name: Kaleem

data.text: Excellent food very friendly 😋
data.name: Gill Burnett

data.text:
There's a big monkey in the garden but I didn't see a drum.

As a man that likes a beer, this place is most certainly one that sells them.

If supping pints is your game, then this pub is the place to be.

Sip a few frosties on me if you go x
data.name: Calum Gray

data.text: Really decent down to Earth Pub, On the pricier side but that is to be expecting in Alderley Edge. Currently as of this review the food was great and the outdoor Seating and Heating really made my stay enjoyable.
data.name: Archie Somers

data.text: Starter was lovely, main southern fried chicken burger wasn't good.
data.name: Jane Grant

data.text: Great covid safe experience. Ate under a huge canopy. Table service fast and friendly and the food was just fantastic, best roast I remember with huge Yorkshires. Rest of food was excellent too. There was a canopied area a marquee and outside seating with parasols plenty of space.  Will be back for sure!
data.name: Mark Thompson

data.text: Well organised with all Covid protocols in place. Staff were slow to start with but no complaints once things got going. Food was tasty - salt and pepper calamari was excellent as was the sticky beef with rice noodles. Heaters were available in the covered areas but jackets stayed on
data.name: Penny Kirk

data.text: Booked for a quick pint and bite to eat. Really well done covid safety well done to all your team.
data.name: James Foreman

data.text: Great place with excellent outside seating, lovely staff and really good food 👌👌👌
data.name: Nicky B

data.text: Excellent pub. Food is wonderful and the staff are all really friendly and helpful
data.name: Denis Rowley

data.text: Food lovely, staff very friendly and kind
data.name: Mary Stephens

data.text: Did a trial shift here for a chef job, now trials generally last 2-3 hours. Head chef asked if I would stay for 8-9 hours. Obviously trials are unpaid and this wouldn't normally bother me if there was a job at the end of it. I think he was taking advantage because he was busy. 2 stars because the food was amazing. The slave labour was terrible
data.name: Mark Elliott

data.text: Very nice restaurant and great atmosphere
data.name: Jonny Scott

data.text: Amazing Sunday lunch! Big portions and very delicious! Hope we can come back soon again! 👍🔜
data.name: Thomas B

data.text: The service was appalling - we walked out after not getting our food in an hour and a half. Others who were in our group had finished and we still hadn't been served.
data.name: Jim Borggren

data.text: Good portion sizes (picture is a starter), friendly and helpful staff, beautiful setting with lovely outdoor area. Highly recommend and will definitely return 🍽
data.name: CC

data.text: Great pub hidden away. Lovely food and friendly staff.
data.name: Sara Cummings

data.text: Best vegetarian meal I've had. Halloumi sweet chilli salad with noodles and cashew nuts. Delicious. Would have been 5 stars if they had dog biscuits for our pup.
data.name: Liz Banks

data.text: Decent food and good beers, located in hear of village.
data.name: Виктор Кузнецов

data.text: Hi. Had a Sunday lunch takeaway yesterday.  Fabulous.  Support your local pubs and restaurants during this crisis.  Thanks to the staff at the drum. 🍷
data.name: david cummings

data.text: Excellent service, delicious 😋 fish and chips
data.name: vincent pagent

data.text: Try the Sticky Beef with  noodles. Great comfort food.
data.name: Colin Mills

data.text: Excellent roast!! Massive portions. Good outdoor eating space with heated lamps
data.name: Mehrunnisha Khan

data.text: New menu , LOVELY schnitzel, very yummy,  chicken and prawns stir fry, delicious and beautiful presented. 😋
data.name: Maria Jose Canda

data.text: The place is really nice and the staff is friendly and polite but ,I am afraid, the food needs improving.  We took a steak and ale pie and fish and chips, the vegetables weren't cooked and covered with rock salt, the fish wasn't crunchy at all. It's a pity because the place is really nice.
data.name: Francesca

data.text: Great marquee social drink and outside
data.name: JP Creative IT

data.text: Something a bit different to the Alderley strip, nice people and a large beer garden Robinson's house with well looked after beer, pretty good selection of scotch.
data.name: Giles Napier

data.text: Lovely food and excellent service
data.name: Caroline Hulse

data.text: Food was good pub food but alittle over priced, we were also told to wait outside for service but no one ever came so we went up to the bar where they said they would give table service again.
data.name: Arron

data.text: Been a few times now. Food always great and the service even better. Highly recommend
data.name: Philip Jones

data.text: Fantastic Gem in Alderley Edge, away from the Rat race set in a Wonderful backwater. Food excellent
data.name: john and fiona doorbar

data.text: Went here for the first time  food excellent staff very friendly and helpful really enjoyed it. Will be going again
data.name: Barbara Wayman

data.text: Excellent food served by really good staff. Despite the necessary social distancing the pub felt very comfortable & safe.
data.name: Clare Townend

data.text: Had a table on Saturday with friends. The staff were friendly and the food delicious. Great atmosphere both inside and outside - even in Covid-19 strange times. Will definitely be back!
data.name: K Burton

data.text: Good food, nice atmosphere, young staff
data.name: Susan Price

data.text: Gerat service, home cooked food
data.name: Rachael Fennessey

data.text: Beautiful beer garden. Lovely for a sunny afternoon.
data.name: Deborah Walsh

data.text: Nice Ambience; The fish and chips I tasted ever...
data.name: Rajik M

data.text: Very nice place
data.name: Edmond Kelleher

data.text: Wonderful tasty lunchime meal (recomend the ribs) with excellent friendly sevice and good value. The Drum and Monkey is a hidden gem.
data.name: Joan Warburton

data.text: Absolutely gorgeous restaurant, friendly efficient staff and lovely food! Definatly worth a visit.
data.name: Jacqueline Baddeley

data.text: Nice place. Lovely atmosphere. Didn't sample any food, so can't give it 5 stars as a food place. Will come back and try the food. Service was excellent.

data.text: Great pub fantastic food

data.text: So wouldn't normally do this but just felt like it. Had a trial shift probably going back 2 months now. I was there for 6 hours. I've had a few trial shifts in my time probably lasting 3 hours maximum. Head chef even wanted me to stay longer. How do you justify a 6 hour trial shift and not even here back. I wasn't bothered about not getting the job when the head chef says you will be the first to know and don't hear nothing, well he panicked to much anyway. Can't give you a compliment on the food as I didn't try any. What can I say

data.text:
Friendly Pub with lots of space outside for kids to run round.

Suffered a bit from staff being too busy when we visited for Sunday lunch.
Bit of a long wait for bar service and although reasonably priced our meals were hit and miss. Half of us pleased other half disappointed.

Overall all good choice of pub in alderley edge.  Friendly, reasonably priced and lots of space outside. Can be hit and miss with food when busy.

data.text: Great pub for locals and others, serving Robinson's ale. Food is excellent and staff friendly and welcoming. Restricted menu but of excellent quality. Exceptional beer garden for both adults and children. Dog friendly is a bonus. Warning! This pub is hidden away and easily missed: use your satnav.

data.text: Mmmmmmmmm

data.text: Nice little pub. Alderly Edges best kept secret. Great beer garden!
data.name: Dave Mac

data.text: The worst meal & eating experience I have ever had. There was no management in the building. A 19yr old boy was doing the cooking who wasn't a chef & the waitress was in tears & said it was a shambles. Our steaks were not cooked as we ordered them & had to go back - when they were brought back parts of the meal were missing & the sauce had not been re done. We ordered puddings and were told they weren't available. Another customer burnt her hand on jug holding custard it was so hot and the first aid kit was virtually none existent. Health and safety should definitely take a look at this place.
data.name: Patricia Cummings

data.text: Great management and staff lovely setting and fantastic service
